column1: The American Pekin is large and solidly built. The body is rectangular as seen from the side and is held at about 40º to the horizontal; the tail projects above the line of the back.:93 The breast is smooth and broad and does not show a pronounced keel. The head is large and rounded
column2: and the neck is thick. The plumage is creamy white
column3: the legs and feet are a yellowish orange.  The beak is yellow

column1: The American Pekin is raised almost exclusively for meat.:193 In the United States
column2: more than half of all ducks raised for slaughter are of this breed.:93 Numbers in the United States alone are in the tens of millions. The birds are large-framed
column3: hardy and fast-growing – they may reach a body-weight of more than 3.5 kg (8 lb) in seven weeks. They have a high feed conversion ratio
column5: and their eggs have a high rate of hatchability.:93 The white feathers make the carcass easy to clean after being plucked.:193A number of commercial strains have been developed
column6: including types kept solely as layers. From the time the birds reached the United States
column7: selective breeding of meat birds was mainly directed towards size
